clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Efficacy and Safety of Brolucizumab vs. Aflibercept in Chinese Patients With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration
clinical_study.official_title: A Twelve-Month, Randomized, Double-Masked, Multicenter, Phase III, Two-Arm Study Comparing the Efficacy and Safety of Brolucizumab 6 mg Versus Aflibercept in Chinese Patients With Neovascular Age-Related Macular Degeneration

brief_summary.textblock: To compare brolucizumab to aflibercept in Chinese patients with untreated active choroidal neovascularization (CNV) secondary to age-related macular degeneration (AMD)

clinical_study.why_stopped: Only recruitment temporarily paused due to safety measures

primary_outcome.description: To demonstrate that brolucizumab 6 mg is not inferior to aflibercept 2 mg with respect to the change in BCVA

primary_outcome.measure: Average change in Best-Corrected Visual Acuity
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, over the period Week 36 to Week 48
primary_outcome.description: To demonstrate that brolucizumab 6 mg is not inferior to aflibercept 2 mg with respect to the change in BCVA

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with treatment regimen of every 12 weeks in brolucizumab arm
secondary_outcome.description: To estimate the proportion of q12w subjects (1 injection every 12 weeks) up to Week 48 in the brolucizumab 6 mg treatment arm"

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with treatment regimen of every 12 weeks (q12w) interval at Week 48 of those who do not need every 8 weeks treatment interval in brolucizumab arm
secondary_outcome.description: To estimate the predictive value of the first regimen of every 12 weeks (q12w) cycle (at Week 16 and Week 20) for maintenance of q12w treatment regimen

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Best Corrected Visual Acuity (BCVA)
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period

secondary_outcome.measure: Average change in Best-Corrected Visual Acuity

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, over the period of Week 12 to Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who gain in best-correct visual acuity of 15/10/5 letters or more

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects with Best-Corrected Visual Acuity of 73 letters or more at each visit
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who loss in best-corrected visual acuity of 15/10/5 letters or more
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Central Subfield Thickness Total
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period by assessing changes in anatomical parameters

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period by assessing changes in anatomical parameters

secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period by assessing changes in anatomical parameters

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who need every 8 weeks injection
secondary_outcome.description: To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg over the time period by assessing changes in anatomical parameters To evaluate the efficacy of brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg at the end of the matched treatment phase

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subject reported outcomes (Visual Function Questionnaire-25) total and subscale scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Weeks 24 and Week 48
secondary_outcome.description: To assess visual function-related subject reported outcomes following treatment with brolucizumab 6 mg relative to aflibercept 2 mg. The VFQ-25 includes a series of 25 questions pertaining to vision or feelings about a vision condition. Answers are selected among a numbered list of possible responses, the values of which are ultimately recoded and converted to a 0 to 100 scale. Items within each subscale are averaged together to create 12 subscale scores. An overall composite score will be calculated by averaging vision-targeted subscale scores, excluding the general health rating question.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects who have positive anti-drug antibodies status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Baseline (enrollment), Weeks 4, 12, 24, 36, and 48 (End of Study)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess immunogenicity of brolucizumab 6 mg

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters: Cmax after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22, and Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: PK draw 6 hours post-injection on Day 1, after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects to assess Cmax (maximum concentration) of brolucizumab at 6 mg following a single intravitreal injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters: Tmax after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22, and Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: PK draw 6 hours post-injection on Day 1, after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects to assess Tmax (time to maximum concenration) of brolucizumab at 6 mg following a single intravitreal injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters: AUClast after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22, and Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: PK draw 6 hours post-injection on Day 1, after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects to assess AUClast (Area under the curve up to the last validated measurable plasma concentration) of brolucizumab at 6 mg following a single intravitreal injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters: AUCinf after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22, and Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: PK draw 6 hours post-injection on Day 1, after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects to assess AUCinf (area under the curve total exposure) of brolucizumab at 6 mg following a single intravitreal injection

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic parameters: Thalf after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, Day 2, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22, and Day 29
secondary_outcome.description: PK draw 6 hours post-injection on Day 1, after first brolucizumab 6 mg dose in a subset of subjects to assess Thalf (time to elimination of half-life) of brolucizumab at 6 mg following a single intravitreal injection

intervention.description: Subjects will receive Brolucizumab 3 x q4w up to Week 8 followed by q12w / q8w up to Week 40 or Week 44, depending on disease activity status.
Subjects will receive Aflibercept 3 x q4w up to Week 8 followed by q8w up to Week 40.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent must be obtained before any assessment is performed.
- Active choroidal neovascularization (CNV) lesions secondary to AMD that affect the central subfield in the study eye
- Total area of CNV>50% of the total lesion area in the study eye at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any active intraocular or periocular infection or active intraocular inflammation (e.g. infectious conjunctivitis, keratitis, scleritis, endophthalmitis, infectious blepharitis, uveitis) in study eye at Baseline.
- Central subfield of the study eye affected by fibrosis or geographic atrophy
- Uncontrolled glaucoma in the study eye defined as intraocular pressure (IOP) >25 mmHg
- Previous treatment with any anti-VEGF drugs in the study eye.
- Previous treatment with any approved or investigational drugs for neovascular AMD in the study eye.
Other protocol-specified inclusion or exclusion criteria may apply.

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
